member.name: T:Serilog.ConfigurationLoggerConfigurationExtensions
member.summary: Extends with support for System.Configuration appSettings elements.

member.name: F:Serilog.ConfigurationLoggerConfigurationExtensions.DefaultSectionName
member.summary: Configuration section name required by this package.

member.name: M:Serilog.ConfigurationLoggerConfigurationExtensions.Configuration(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSettingsConfiguration,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,System.String,Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyModel.DependencyContext)
member.summary: Reads logger settings from the provided configuration object using the provided section name. Generally this is preferable over the other method that takes a configuration section. Only this version will populate IConfiguration parameters on target methods.
member.param: Logger setting configuration.
A configuration object which contains a Serilog section.
A section name for section which contains a Serilog section.
The dependency context from which sink/enricher packages can be located. If not supplied, the platform default will be used.
member.returns: An object allowing configuration to continue.

member.name: T:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationAssemblySource
member.summary: Defines how the package will identify the assemblies which are scanned for sinks and other Type information.

member.name: F:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationAssemblySource.UseLoadedAssemblies
member.summary: Try to scan the assemblies already in memory. This is the default. If GetEntryAssembly is null, fallback to DLL scanning.

member.name: F:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationAssemblySource.AlwaysScanDllFiles
member.summary: Scan for assemblies in DLLs from the working directory. This is the fallback when GetEntryAssembly is null.

member.name: T:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions
member.summary: Options to adjust how the configuration object is processed.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.
member.param: A collection of assemblies that contains sinks and other types.

member.name: M:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Prefer the constructor taking explicit assemblies: . It's the only one supporting single-file publishing.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.
member.param: The dependency context from which sink/enricher packages can be located. If , the platform default will be used.
member.remarks: Prefer the constructor taking explicit assemblies: . It's the only one supporting single-file publishing.

member.param: Defines how the package identifies assemblies to scan for sinks and other types.
member.remarks: Prefer the constructor taking explicit assemblies: . It's the only one supporting single-file publishing.

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.SectionName
member.summary: The section name for section which contains a Serilog section. Defaults to Serilog.

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.FormatProvider
member.summary: The used when converting strings to other object types. Defaults to the invariant culture.

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.AllowInternalTypes
member.summary: Allows to use internal types for extension methods for sink configuration. Defaults to .

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.AllowInternalMethods
member.summary: Allows to use internal extension methods for sink configuration. Defaults to .

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.OnLevelSwitchCreated
member.summary:
Called when a log level switch is created while reading the configuration. Log level switches are created either from the Serilog:LevelSwitches section (declared switches) or the Serilog:MinimumLevel:Override section (minimum level override switches).
For declared switches, the switch name includes the leading $ character.
For minimum level override switches, the switch name is the (partial) namespace or type name of the override.

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.OnFilterSwitchCreated
member.summary: Called when a log filter switch is created while reading the Serilog:FilterSwitches section of the configuration.

member.name: T:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ILoggingFilterSwitch
member.summary: A log event filter that can be modified at runtime.
member.remarks: Under the hood, the logging filter switch is either a Serilog.Expressions.LoggingFilterSwitch or a Serilog.Filters.Expressions.LoggingFilterSwitch instance.

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ILoggingFilterSwitch.Expression
member.summary: A filter expression against which log events will be tested. Only expressions that evaluate to true are included by the filter. A null expression will accept all events.

member.name: T:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ResolutionContext
member.summary: Keeps track of available elements that are useful when resolving values in the settings system.

member.name: M:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ResolutionContext.LookUpLevelSwitchByName(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up a switch in the declared LoggingLevelSwitches
member.param: the name of a switch to look up
member.returns: the LoggingLevelSwitch registered with the name
member.exception: if no switch has been registered with

member.name: T:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.SurrogateConfigurationMethods
member.summary:
Contains "fake extension" methods for the Serilog configuration API. By default the settings know how to find extension methods, but some configuration are actually "regular" method calls and would not be found otherwise.
This static class contains internal methods that can be used instead.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnscopedRefAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate a byref escapes and is not scoped.

remarks.para: There are several cases where the C# compiler treats a as implicitly - where the compiler does not allow the to escape the method.

For example:
for instance methods.
parameters that refer to types.
parameters.
This attribute is used in those instances where the should be allowed to escape.

Applying this attribute, in any form, has impact on consumers of the applicable API. It is necessary for API authors to understand the lifetime implications of applying this attribute and how it may impact their users.

member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Index)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Index.op_Implicit(System.Int32)~System.Index
member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

member.name: M:System.Index.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Index object to its equivalent string representation.

Represent the exclusive end index of the range.

member.name: M:System.Range.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Range object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Range.Equals(System.Range)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Range object is equal to another Range object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Range.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Range.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Range object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: M:System.Range.StartAt(System.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from start index to the end of the collection.

member.name: M:System.Range.EndAt(System.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element in the collection to the end Index.

member.name: P:System.Range.All
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element to the end.

member.name: M:System.Range.GetOffsetAndLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the start offset and length of range object using a collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the range will be used with. length has to be a positive value.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter against negative values. It is expected Range will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. We validate the range is inside the length scope though.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsExternalInit

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ModuleInitializerAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that a method should be called in its containing module's initializer.
member.remarks:
When one or more valid methods with this attribute are found in a compilation, the compiler will emit a module initializer which calls each of the attributed methods.
Certain requirements are imposed on any method targeted with this attribute: - The method must be `static`. - The method must be an ordinary member method, as opposed to a property accessor, constructor, local function, etc. - The method must be parameterless. - The method must return `void`. - The method must not be generic or be contained in a generic type. - The method's effective accessibility must be `internal` or `public`.
The specification for module initializers in the .NET runtime can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/design/specs/Ecma-335-Augments.md#module-initializer

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiredMemberAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a type has required members or that a member is required.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.SkipLocalsInitAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that the .locals init flag should not be set in method headers.
